result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander L. Weihert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #13CF429, #14CF201, #14CF231 called at 3:34pm.
Defendant Alexander L. Weihert in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
 
AS TO CASE #14CF231: 
Initial Appearance conducted:  Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Waiver of Prelim occurs:  Mr. Weihert waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment held:  Service of Information admitted, reading waived. ,maximum penalties recited
Plea Hearing held: Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Weihert guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF201.
--------------------------------------------
SENTENCING AS TO CASE #14CF231:
The Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Weihert on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--to serve 9 months in the Jefferson County Jail with work-release privileges for all purposes, to commence forthwith
--Mr. Weihert is required to serve the jail term without alcohol or non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no acts or threats of violence
--for the first six months after release from incarceration, Mr. Weihert is to have an in-person visit with the Agent at least two times per month, and then for next 6 months thereafter he is to have an in-person visit with the Agent at least once per month; thereafter the in -person meetings with the Agent are to be as designated by the Agent
--no contact with Kylie Minnameier, Daniel Otte, Stacy Otte, Samantha Otte, Meagan Montiel, Nicholas Ziegel
--to pay restitution of $600  to Pawn America, Madison WI [related to read-in case #14CF201]
--to pay resitution of $135 to LA Tan, Watertown WI 
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fees
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational program
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
The Court will not allow expungement of this record.
---------------------------------------------

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION AS TO CASE #13CF429:
On Count #1: the Court sentences Mr. Weihert to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes, to commence forthwith
On Count #2: the Court sentences Mr. Weihert to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes, to commence forthwith, concurrent with Ct. #1
On Count #3: the Court sentences Mr. Weihert to serve 9 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes, concurrent to Counts #1 & #2
As to all three counts, Mr. Weihert is required to serve the jail term without alcohol or non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
Days credit for time already served:  58 days
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for unpaid financial obligations, the financial amounts now include the $200 DNA surcharge added as a financial obligation on each of the three counts.  The Court indicates that if the DNA surcharge is found to be unconstitutional, and the Defendant has not yet paid the surcharge, then the Judgment of Conviction is to be amended to remove the surcharge payment requirement.  If the DNA surcharge has been paid and the ruling that found the DNA surcharge unconstitutional directs the clerks to reimburse the amount paid, then the clerk is to refund the amount paid to the Defendant. If the reimbursement is not mandated, then the amount will be kept.
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given.
recess 4:16pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 12, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 11:10am.
Defendant Alexander L. Weihert appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  His counsel, Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek is present in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Information admitted; reading is waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "not guilty" is entered
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.
recess 11:13am.

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/6/14 at 2:00pm  (2) schedule Plea/Sentencing on 8/12/14 at 3:30pm.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #13CF429 and #14CF201 called at 9:49am. 
Defendant Alexander L. Weihert in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

IN CASE #14CF201:
Mr. Weihert waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Attorney Svehlek requests that Arraignment be scheduled for a later date. 
------------------------------------------------------------

IN CASE #13CF429:
The Court clarifies for the Record that Attorney Svehlek does not represent Mr. Weihert in the portion of the hearing as to this case. 
The Court notes that it is in receipt of a proposed ATR, but the Court would like information from Agent Zabinski regarding the bases for her proposing this alternative to revocation for a relatively short jail term, after Mr. Weihert was on absconder status for such a lengthy time.  The Court will reschedule the Probation Review Hearing, and in the interim ADA Hall will make inquiry of Agent Zabinski.
recess 9:54am.  


NEXT:   (1) reschedule the Probation Review Hearing in caes #13CF429  (2) schedule Arraignment in case #14CF201 within thirty days

[KG]
Case called at 2:34 pm.  

Defendant Alexander L. Weihert in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court of Mr. Weihert's current address: 5009 Mahor Avenue, Madison 53716
The Court notes that Judge Weston previously found Probable Cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.
The Court finds the warrant satisfied by Mr. Weihert's appearance. It should be removed from any database in which it is entered.

Court requires $500 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Daniel Otte, Stacy Otte, Samantha Otte, Nicholas Ziegel or Megan Montiel
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Robert Weihert 
-Maintain absolute sobriety

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit.

Recess: 2:45 pm
